page.title: 04Road and Rail routes:Kirkby
page.content: An examination of transport communications by Sylvia and Jackie {Major Roads: }The nearest motorway is the M57 which joins to the M62 which is the main road route from Liverpool to Manchester and Leeds. The M62 also joins the M6 which is the main routeway to the north and the opposite direction the the midlands and the south. The main road through Kirkby is County Road which joins the East Lancashire Road. This used to be the main road joining Liverpool to Manchester before the motorways were built. {Trains:}You can travel from Kirkby to Liverpool via Fazakerley and Rice Lane, where it then joins another branch of the Northern Line which goes to Liverpool or Ormskirk. You can also go to Wigan from Kirkby.
